translation.nowAs: Now as a Full Stack Developer
translation.aboutDes: I graduated with a degree in Materials Science and have a strong passion for board games. In early 2023, while creating a dice simulator for D&D, I discovered my passion for software development. This discovery inspired me to change my career path, investing significant time in self-learning programming, ultimately succeeding in transitioning to become a software engineer.
translation.photoDes: This is what I usually like
translation.currentDes1: Currently working as a Full Stack Engineer in manufacturing, developing
translation.currentDes3: applications. Using C# .NET Framework and MVC architecture, I handle the complete development process from database design, backend API development to frontend interface implementation. Main projects include supplier measurement systems, parameter management systems, SPC data ETL processing, and currently developing an NFC-based patrol attendance system.
translation.currentDesEnd: In this role, I've not only enhanced my full-stack development capabilities but also accumulated practical experience in handling production line issues, system deployment.
translation.2023.01: Starting Point: Began learning programming to create a dice simulator for D&D board games, discovering my passion for software development.
translation.2023.04: Started systematic learning of frontend technologies: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals.
translation.2023.06: Deep dive into React.js framework, implementing multiple practice projects to familiarize with modern frontend development workflow.
translation.2023.08: Career Transition Success! First software engineer position - Frontend Engineer for factory internal systems. Developed HR management system attendance interface, dispatch system, and business data management interface. Used React with frontend-backend separation architecture.
translation.2024.01: Continuous Self-Learning: Explored Unity game development, attempted to create an RPG game. Though not completed, gained understanding of game development processes.
translation.2024.03: Started learning backend technologies: C# language, WebSocket real-time communication, and backend service development, preparing to become a full-stack engineer.
translation.2024.07: Joined current company as Full Stack Engineer, primarily developing MES systems with C#. Responsible for measurement data collection pages and supplier-specific systems as core functional modules.
translation.2024.09: Skill Expansion: Independently completed MVC website setup and IIS deployment, handled security protection (XSS, SQL Injection prevention, etc.), and began taking full responsibility for supplier external system development.
translation.2025.01: Present: Developing NFC-based patrol attendance system, integrating mobile NFC sensing with backend systems. Continuously learning TypeScript and Next.js to enhance frontend development skills.
translation.aboutnow-1: In just 1.5 years as a software engineer, I've rapidly grown from zero foundation to a capable full-stack engineer. My current role has given me complete system development experience: from requirement gathering, database design, API development, frontend implementation, to system deployment and maintenance.
translation.aboutnow-2: Given the rapid rise of AI, I constantly reflect on future tech trends. I am actively self-studying AI and Computer Vision (CV) to stay competitive and keep pace with the industry.
translation.project01des1: A project inspired by Notion and Trello, intended to display notes as a blog in the future. This project is built using TypeScript and Next.js. Authentication is implemented with NextAuth, supporting email verification and two-factor authentication. The Notion-like part uses the BlockNote component to mimic native Notion operations, while the Trello-like part allows the creation of multiple boards. Each board functions as an independent to-do list where cards or lists can be reordered by drag-and-drop.
translation.project02des1: This this for helping me to record boardgame state, using signalR (websocket) on azure, more displays and presentations are available in the Notion link below.
translation.project03des1: Implemented API functionality using .NET. Currently, it supports authentication, API versioning, Docker deployment, and Azure deployment.
translation.project04des1: This data storage feature is built using .NET. It mainly includes a master list and sub-items, both of which can be added, deleted, and modified. The sub-items can store images and directly copy the images into the project's directory.
translation.project05des1: A project requested by a company, only required to demonstrate the mobile interface and sliding smoothness. Although it has no functionality, it is still showcased. *Note: This project does not have responsive design and looks proper only on mobile devices.*
